title: Internal communications concerning Proposed Claim for Injunction Letters sent to Tree Campaigners in 2017

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
This is a Freedom of Information Request.
Please could you provide the following:
Copies of all communications, whether email, text, whatsapp or other means between Councillors and Officers (Councillor to Councillor; Officer to Officer; Councillor to Officer and Officer to Councillor) concerning the proposal, development and decisions which led to the issuing of the Proposed Claim for Injunction Letters  and the Undertaking signed by many campaigners.
Please could you also provide Minutes of any meetings where this matter was discussed.
I presume these documents will include, but not be limited to, communications involving Gillian Duckworth, Steve Eccleston, Julie Dore, Brian Lodge, Paul Billington, James Henderson.
Please could you respond to this Request within the statutory limit of 20 working days, ie no later than 25th August 2023.
Yours faithfully,
Helen McIlroy

Dear Helen McIlroy,
I am writing in relation to FOI 898215 to apologise that we will not be
able to provide a response to your request within the initial timescale
set out in our email of 02/08/2023.
Section 10(3) of the Freedom of information Act 2000 enables an authority
to extend the 20 working day limit up to a ‘reasonable’ time in any case
where:
·         it requires more time to determine whether or not the balance of
the public interest lies in maintaining an exemption; or
·         it needs further time to consider whether it would be in the
public interest to confirm or deny whether the information is held.
Sheffield City Council has not yet reached a decision on whether or not
the balance of the public interest lies in maintaining an exemption, in
this case, section 42(1) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the
grounds that the information is subject to legal professional privilege
(LPP). As a result, we will not be able to respond to your request in full
by the statutory disclosure date.
Under section 45(1) of the Freedom of information Act 2000 (FOIA), the
Minister for the Cabinet Office has issued a [1]Code of Practice which
provides guidance to public bodies on request handling.
Section 4.6 of that guidance states that it is best practice for an
extension to be no more than a further 20 working days, although, in some
circumstances, a longer extension may be appropriate.
Consequently, we are extending the deadline by an additional 20 working
days until 26/09/2023 at the latest, but we will endeavour to provide a
response as soon as possible.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Internal communications concerning Proposed Claim for Injunction Letters sent to Tree Campaigners in 2017'.
The following request was submitted on 30th July 2023. I have yet to receive a response. I therefore wish to complain and to requwsr an internal review.
My question:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
This is a Freedom of Information Request.
Please could you provide the following:
Copies of all communications, whether email, text, whatsapp or other means between Councillors and Officers (Councillor to Councillor; Officer to Officer; Councillor to Officer and Officer to Councillor) concerning the proposal, development and decisions which led to the issuing of the Proposed Claim for Injunction Letters and the Undertaking signed by many campaigners.
Please could you also provide Minutes of any meetings where this matter was discussed.
I presume these documents will include, but not be limited to, communications involving Gillian Duckworth, Steve Eccleston, Julie Dore, Brian Lodge, Paul Billington, James Henderson.
Please could you respond to this Request within the statutory limit of 20 working days, ie no later than 25th August 2023.
Yours faithfully,
Helen McIlroy
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/i...
Yours faithfully,
Helen McIlroy

Dear Helen McIlroy,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to
proposed claim for Injunction letters which we received on 19/02/2024. We
are sorry to hear that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Freedom of Information Code of Practice states that we should aim to
your request for internal review within 20 working days, by 18/03/2024.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you
have any queries.
Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this.
If you have any queries in the meantime, please contact us at the email
address below.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
